channel.title: Its snowing like crazy
channel.description:
Well here in Indiana. (terrible state) We receive quite a fair amount of snow in the winter. I was just wondering if any of you guys get snow.
If so what hobbies do you do in it.
[IMG]http://i50.photobucket.com/albums/f304/surfdude2012/snowboardpictures002.jpg[/img]
I personally have a love for snowboarding.
[IMG]http://i50.photobucket.com/albums/f304/surfdude2012/snowboardpictures004.jpg[/img]
EDIT: friend came over. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TfR7rdWZLog
[IMG]http://i50.photobucket.com/albums/f304/surfdude2012/FILE0135.jpg[/img]
Lol cats.

Here in Australia (i’ve never seen snow in real life, ever.)

item.title: Its snowing like crazy
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I live in Michigan, quite a bit of snow but not enough for a snow day
Really cold though, walking home from school one day caused the inside of my mouth to start bleeding.

Read full topic

item.title: Its snowing like crazy
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:63, topic:249164”][quote author=maniown link=topic=328441.msg2572696#msg2572696 date=1228776350]

Oh my god, It’s snowing like hell in Australia.

[img]http://i36.tinypic.com/2cekdtx.jpg

My god… Everything is so green.

Welcome to Australia, it’s a healthy country… well, it is on the coast, where Kane. and I live

Do you guys hang out?

Nop.

Ever even seen eachother?
[/quote]
Wouldn’t surprise me if we have once in our lifetime.[/quote]

Thats really weird that you live in the same general area and don’t ever see each other. (Without knowing.)

Read full topic

item.title: Its snowing like crazy
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:53, topic:249164”][quote author=the bank link=topic=328441.msg2571148#msg2571148 date=1228673901]

Lots of snow in Ottawa, Ontario.

Do you ski or snowboard and what hills do you go to? I’m at Calabogie all the time.
[/quote]Same here, vorlage (or however it is spelled) isn’t bad either.

Also, I board.

Yeah, Mt. Tremblant beats them all though. Its like a 4 hour drive though

I’m either moving to Whistler or Nelson BC, either way they will have ski hills bigger then anything in Ontario.[/quote]Been to Whistler a few times, my cousin lives down there and makes a living giving boarding lessons, a truly awesome job.

Read full topic

item.title: Its snowing like crazy
item.dc:creator: @Ryequis Ryequis_
item.description:
@Ryequis wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:40, topic:249164”][quote author=Ryequis_ link=topic=328441.msg2570229#msg2570229 date=1228615982]
Not for me, for some strange reason =S probably the global warming. But I live on the Eastern side of Canada. So we’ll probably get snow later
[/quote]

Seriously sometimes I just pray for global warming… No more cold winters and shit!
I enjoy rain and sun more than I enjoy snow and the problems it causes :D!
Rain helps me relax somehow hahaha.[/quote]O.O I wouldn’t live a year without snow I love it, I like the cold I get dehydrated in the warm air depending on the temperature of course.

Read full topic
